  • java.lang.Object
    • io.klerch.alexa.utterances.processor.Generator.GeneratorBuilder
  • Enclosing class:

    public static class Generator.GeneratorBuilder
extends Object
    Generator builder taking all the inputs like reference to your grammar specification

      • withInvocationName

        public Generator.GeneratorBuilder withInvocationName(String invocationName)
        Sets the invocation name for the skill whose model is generated. If may overwrite the invocation name specified in the grammar
        Parameters:
        invocationName - invocation name for your Alexa skill
        Returns:
        generator builder

      • withGrammarFile

        public Generator.GeneratorBuilder withGrammarFile(File grammarFile)
        File reference to your grammar specification. If you don't hold your specification in a file and you do not set a reference make sure you call generate(List of strings) instead of generate() in the Generator
        Parameters:
        grammarFile - file reference to your grammar. Make sure this is an absolute path
        Returns:
        generator builder

      • withValuesFilePath

        public Generator.GeneratorBuilder withValuesFilePath(Path valuesFilePath)
        Path reference to folder location where all your values files are stored. This is optional as you may not have used any placeholders in your grammar or specified values within your grammar already. If not set the Generator will look up values files according to the name of unresolved placeholders in your grammar specification in the folder your grammar file is in.
        Parameters:
        valuesFilePath - path reference to folder location where all your values files can be found. Should be an absolute path.
        Returns:
        generator builder

      • disableValidation

        public Generator.GeneratorBuilder disableValidation(boolean skipValidation)
        Disables validation of output which may throw errors in case of e.g. duplicate sample utterances across multiple intents
        Parameters:
        skipValidation - true to disable validation
        Returns:
        generator builder

      • disableCleanup

        public Generator.GeneratorBuilder disableCleanup(boolean skipCleanup)
        Disables cleanup of output e.g. deduplication and sorting of sample utterances
        Parameters:
        skipCleanup - true to disable clean up
        Returns:
        generator builder

      • build

        public Generator build()
        builds the Generator object
        Returns:
        generator object
